intro: Neosasamorpha oshidensis, commonly known as the Oshida's neosasamorpha, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique botanical appearance. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural environment.
